chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon M Stelloh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$11.50 to Walmart; $899.00 to Accident Fund Holdings.  Court reserves it's right regarding any possible additional monies due and owing to be set at another date.
Hearing 8/11/2014.
Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational traning.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow thru with any treatment recommended including any medication regiment.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for her mental or physical well being.  Take as prescribed and only as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
No contact with the WalMart at 6701 S. 27 Street, City of Franklin, County of Milwaukee.

Anger management counseling.  
Parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed. Urine screens.
EACH COUNT:  Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:     08-29-2014      Initials:  AAC

Attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons in court.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing was scheduled for today's date to determine if any other restitution was due and owing.  State advised the court that the amount previously ordered at sentencing was the correct amount and that it would not be requesting any additional monies.  No further action taken by the Court and all components of the sentence remain the same.

Restitution Worksheet with attached form from Walmart, received and filed with:
 - Letter from Accident Fund Holdings dated 5/14/14.

Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 and 3 as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Parties request a separate sentencing date.  Court granted joint request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Shannon M Stelloh in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

/submitted by the State, charging defendant as follows:

COUNT 01:
(Same)

COUNT 02:
Disorderly Conduct, a Class B Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 947.01(1).

COUNT 03:
Obstructing/Resisting an Officer, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 946.41(1).

Defendant Shannon M Stelloh in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court admonished the defendant of late appearance.  Court vacates the warrant.  Defendant has picked up new charges.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Plea hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
